Literature Review: The Effect of AI on Financial Market

literature
Tests
Published

November 24, 2025

1 The impact of artificial intelligence on financial markets

Danielsson, J (2025), “Artificial intelligence and stability”, VoxEU.org, 6 February.

Danielsson, J., Macrae, R., & Uthemann, A. (2022). Artificial intelligence and systemic risk. Journal of Banking & Finance, 140, 106290.

Danielsson, J, and A Uthemann (2024), “AI financial crises”, VoxEU.org, 26 July.

Danielsson, J., & Uthemann, A. (2025). Artificial intelligence and financial crises. Journal of Financial Stability, 101453.

2 The impact of artificial intelligence on markets

Calvano, E, V Denicolo, G Calzolari, and S Pastorello (2019), “Artificial intelligence, algorithmic pricing, and collusion”, VoxEU.org, 3 February.

Calvano, Emilio, Giacomo Calzolari, Vincenzo Denicolò, and Sergio Pastorello. 2020. “Artificial Intelligence, Algorithmic Pricing, and Collusion.” American Economic Review 110 (10): 3267–97.

Calvano, Emilio, Calzolari, Giacomo, Denicolo’, Vincenzo and Pastorello, Sergio, (2019), Algorithmic Pricing What Implications for Competition Policy?, Review of Industrial Organization, 55, issue 1, p. 155-171

Ulrich Schwalbe, ALGORITHMS, MACHINE LEARNING, AND COLLUSION, Journal of Competition Law & Economics, Volume 14, Issue 4, 2018, Pages 568–607

3 Macroeconomic Impact of Artificial Intelligence on the Labor Market

Kudoh, Noritaka & Miyamoto, Hiroaki, 2025. “Robots, AI, and unemployment,” Journal of Economic Dynamics and Control, Elsevier, vol. 174(C).

4 Monetary Economics

Golosov, M. & Tsyvinski, A. & Werquin, N., 2016. “Recursive Contracts and Endogenously Incomplete Markets,” Handbook of Macroeconomics, in: J. B. Taylor & Harald Uhlig (ed.), Handbook of Macroeconomics, edition 1, volume 2, chapter 0, pages 725-841, Elsevier.

Gertler, Mark, Kiyotaki, N. and Prestipino, A., (2016), Wholesale Banking and Bank Runs in Macroeconomic Modeling of Financial Crises, ch. Chapter 16, p. 1345-1425, Elsevier

Brunnermeier, M.K. & Sannikov, Y., 2016. “Macro, Money, and Finance,” Handbook of Macroeconomics, in: J. B. Taylor & Harald Uhlig (ed.), Handbook of Macroeconomics, edition 1, volume 2, chapter 0, pages 1497-1545, Elsevier.

Diamond, D.W. and Kashyap, Anil, (2016), Liquidity Requirements, Liquidity Choice, and Financial Stability, ch. Chapter 29, p. 2263-2303, Elsevier

Angeletos, George-Marios and Lian, C., (2016), Incomplete Information in Macroeconomics, ch. Chapter 14, p. 1065-1240, Elsevier

# The impact of artificial intelligence on financial markets

[Danielsson, J (2025), “Artificial intelligence and stability”, VoxEU.org, 6 February.](https://cepr.org/voxeu/columns/artificial-intelligence-and-stability)

[Danielsson, J., Macrae, R., & Uthemann, A. (2022). Artificial intelligence and systemic risk. Journal of Banking & Finance, 140, 106290.](https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jbankfin.2021.106290)

[Danielsson, J, and A Uthemann (2024), “AI financial crises”, VoxEU.org, 26 July.](https://cepr.org/voxeu/columns/ai-financial-crises)

[Danielsson, J., & Uthemann, A. (2025). Artificial intelligence and financial crises. Journal of Financial Stability, 101453.](https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S1572308925000828)


# The impact of artificial intelligence on markets

[Calvano, E, V Denicolo, G Calzolari, and S Pastorello (2019), “Artificial intelligence, algorithmic pricing, and collusion”, VoxEU.org, 3 February.](https://cepr.org/voxeu/columns/artificial-intelligence-algorithmic-pricing-and-collusion)

[Calvano, Emilio, Giacomo Calzolari, Vincenzo Denicolò, and Sergio Pastorello. 2020. "Artificial Intelligence, Algorithmic Pricing, and Collusion." American Economic Review 110 (10): 3267–97.](https://www.jstor.org/stable/26966472)

[Calvano, Emilio, Calzolari, Giacomo, Denicolo', Vincenzo and Pastorello, Sergio, (2019), Algorithmic Pricing What Implications for Competition Policy?, Review of Industrial Organization, 55, issue 1, p. 155-171](https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s11151-019-09689-3)

[Ulrich Schwalbe, ALGORITHMS, MACHINE LEARNING, AND COLLUSION, Journal of Competition Law & Economics, Volume 14, Issue 4, 2018, Pages 568–607](https://doi.org/10.1093/joclec/nhz004)

# Macroeconomic Impact of Artificial Intelligence on the Labor Market

[Kudoh, Noritaka & Miyamoto, Hiroaki, 2025. "Robots, AI, and unemployment," Journal of Economic Dynamics and Control, Elsevier, vol. 174(C).](https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jedc.2025.105069)

# Monetary Economics

[Golosov, M. & Tsyvinski, A. & Werquin, N., 2016. "Recursive Contracts and Endogenously Incomplete Markets," Handbook of Macroeconomics, in: J. B. Taylor & Harald Uhlig (ed.), Handbook of Macroeconomics, edition 1, volume 2, chapter 0, pages 725-841, Elsevier.](https://doi.org/10.1016/bs.hesmac.2016.03.007)

[Gertler, Mark, Kiyotaki, N. and Prestipino, A., (2016), Wholesale Banking and Bank Runs in Macroeconomic Modeling of Financial Crises, ch. Chapter 16, p. 1345-1425, Elsevier](https://doi.org/10.1016/bs.hesmac.2016.03.009)

[Brunnermeier, M.K. & Sannikov, Y., 2016. "Macro, Money, and Finance," Handbook of Macroeconomics, in: J. B. Taylor & Harald Uhlig (ed.), Handbook of Macroeconomics, edition 1, volume 2, chapter 0, pages 1497-1545, Elsevier.](https://doi.org/10.1016/bs.hesmac.2016.06.002)

[Diamond, D.W. and Kashyap, Anil, (2016), Liquidity Requirements, Liquidity Choice, and Financial Stability, ch. Chapter 29, p. 2263-2303, Elsevier](https://doi.org/10.1016/bs.hesmac.2016.03.011)

[Angeletos, George-Marios and Lian, C., (2016), Incomplete Information in Macroeconomics, ch. Chapter 14, p. 1065-1240, Elsevier](https://doi.org/10.1016/bs.hesmac.2016.04.011)
